title: What are the findings and experiments conducted by Donato regarding magnetism and its different theories?
first_phrase: In the last part (200 tokens) of the text, we witness more experiments by the magnetizer Donato, who demonstrates his ability to control his subjects' movements and actions. The text also explores the different theories behind magnetism, somnambulism, hypnosis, and fascination, including the belief in a so-called "animalized fluid." We meet two subjects in particular: Etienne Secrétas, who resisted Donato's influence despite being his brother's friend, and Enoch Couxat, who could not strike Donato even when he attempted to do so from behind. The experiments continue to challenge the assumptions and beliefs about this mysterious phenomenon.

Mais M. Cornât ne peut se redresser. On le prie de marcher ; il reste en place, immobile, et semble cloué au sol. Sur interpellation il déclare ne pouvoir bouger d’une semelle. Un souffle do Donato le ramène à l'état normal. Afin de mieux étudier la contraction des muscles, les docteurs prient Cornât de se mettre à nu jusqu’à la ceinture et l’engagent ensuite à frapper le magnétiseur. * Voyez ! s’écrient-ils, voyez comme son torse et ses bras se contractent. Il fait des efforts inouïs ! L’arcade sourcilière se contracte également. Il jette des regards furibonds sur son dominateur. Il manifeste violemment la volonté de frapper, mais il ne le peut pas !... last_phrase: In conclusion, the story of Donato and Cornat is not just a tale about mesmerism, but also a tribute to the life and character of the honest and courageous Xavier Mouls. While his attempt to establish a new religious communion failed, he was an excellent healer and a passionate advocate of magnetism. Mouls' life is a reminder that our beliefs and convictions must be grounded in reason and empirical evidence, and that we should never give up on our principles in the face of adversity.
